title: I'm glad that everything is slowly being nerfed instead of buffed
body:
It's better to nerf things than continuesly buff something that is underperforming, since the damage in the game was too high overall (as it was said by many players).

* Midlane Mages receiving some nerfs (not sure if they really needed them, you make the judgement)

* Marksman hoping to receive some nerfs soon, that are going to appear in PBE any day.

* Junglers having their early power lowered to lower the impact.

There are more changes but none that come to mind right now. Personally I think that Riot is going in the right direction. 

What are your thoughts on the recent and upcoming changes to the balancing?

YEa, these guys need an actual damage nerf.

They need nerfs to clear speed/health and vision adjustment so there's less of a window to gank mid.

The damage isn't the problem, it's the amount of time they can invest in pressuring the lane.  That comes from easily clearing camps or just ignoring them in favor of ganking.
Lowering damage would lower clear speed, and lower their health... Ganking would also be harder. Win win.

Thing is early game damage is where most if not all of Junglers importance is :/

I'd rather see camps reward less XP and gold, are a bit squished, but respawn much faster so that more farming is promoted to be relevant. What junglers lack is late game presence since camps give no real xp or gold after level 6, they quickly fall down in relevance.
If you lower damage in lanes ganks also become less effective.
I think both should be lowered.
